comment: The professor was cool. I did not have that much interaction with her. The assignments were posted and I just did them. I would say if you want someone that just gives work and you do it, then she is for you. I loved it but some people want more. It is an online class so I do not need much. The test are open note and no lockdown.
PLEASE AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! She does not care if the content that is required to pass is accessible!!!!!!!!
This professor requires you to access links for homework that barely work. AVOID HER at all cost especially if you pay out of pocket.

This is by far the best online class I have taken for science. The entire course is laid out from the beginning and she gives you ample time to complete all the assignments for the unit. Tests are open note. The MES are work heavy but again you have ample time to complete them. She listens to her students. Discussions are fairly easy too.

If you're good at self-managing your own time, you should definitely take her. I took her because she was one of the only teachers available, and she shocked me with how easy this class is if you actually study. Just study the MES, and that's your ticket for an A.

I am so shocked to see the score this professor has. This is by far the best online class I have ever taken. She gives us plenty of time to complete simple homework and seems to care and listen to her students. She has the entire course laid out at the beginning of the year so I had all the due dates written down months in advance.

The work was very clear and organized for an online class. Just do the homework and read the chapters, they're short and simple. The tests were open notes, so make sure you organize your notes and write down what you need. Caring about her students and adjusts due dates if necessary. Genuinely cares about her students. Her rating should be higher.

Don't take this professor. Took her for an online class and she has the most unclear grading criteria and due dates I've ever seen in my three years at Kennesaw State. Due dates on d2l and pulse don't match the actual due dates for a lot of the assignments.

Dr. Abikoye's class was very straightforward with grading material. Each week, we had MMES assignments that were to be completed at the end of the unit. Tests were open-note and easy if notes were taken! No feedback on anything, which was confusing, but overall, an easy A. The discussions were time-consuming but interesting!

You have homework, discussion posts, and tests that are open note. It was a very easy class and not much was required. Some weeks took some effort because a lot was due but you can do things in advance and not have work for weeks. She responded to an email a week after something was due but I rarely had to email her anyways.

Be aware that 80% of her work is just online homeworks but it's pretty easy to finish! You can't get them wrong (for me of course) BUT BE AWARE THAT SHE NEVER RESPOND TO YOUR EMAILS. She is 100% absent so it's impossible to reach out to her for an emergency or questions. She's also a picky grader on exams. Takes her 2 months to grade. Shocker...

Professor Abikoye takes over a week to respond to questions, if at all. She also failed to show up to a scheduled zoom meeting from someone in my class. If I have to pay an unavoidable $100 for Pearson's Mastering program and do assignments found online, I at least expect the prof to do her job and record a lecture, or be involved at all.

If I could give it a 0, I would. The professor barely responses to your emails, and there is no clear direction for the course. I think the layout of the course is not for online. I truly wished I would have looked at the reviews of this course before taking this particular professor.

For an online class its ok not the best. Everything is pretty straight forward but the labs that she has u do is a bit difficult sometimes n u have to do them bc every 3 labs u get a mod lab quiz.  I asked questions once abt it and she wasn't very much help just kept leading me to the resources listed on d2l tht weren't helpful for me at least.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: You have easy work with something called Mastering Assignments that you have to pay $100 for.BUT she takes FOREVER to grade.Big discussions which are easy but heavy.The labs are ridiculous.Does not have herself assigned any office hours so you have to make an appointment with her.

I have NEVER written a review about a professor EVER however, professor Abikoye is by far the worst professor that I have chosen. First to note, the outline of her class is completely confusing for online. Every other one of my classes has a clear outline that this professor lacks.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I hated this class because of Professor Abikoye. She NEVER graded our discussions or tests that should have been automatically graded. She replied to some students but ignored others. I think she is a guest lecturer, which I assumed would be easier, but she just sucked so much. I would recommend literally anyone else. Save your mental state!!

I have taken higher level courses that were easier than this, and its core. This class was so frustrating. The professor was wildly unorganized, and none of her content was connected. This class is almost impossible to succeed in, and she does not care about you, or your grades. You were lucky if you could even FIND assignments.

Terrible instructor, doesn't care about her students at all, doesn't excuse any absences ever, never responds to her emails, doesn't teach anything at all basically everything is from the textbooks. not worth the time and stress at all
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She never responded to emails. Her class is super hard, literally take any other professor, you will probably have a better chance of passing. Her assignments make no sense and she doesn't set up anything in her own class. She uses all textbook.
Tests are kind of difficult (questions based on MMES and powerpoints). She responds to emails super fast. The only homework is the MMES (required) and textbook readings if you choose to do so.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: There's MMES assignments for each chapter, 3 major discussions and 4 tests. She drops your lowest test grade and all tests are open book. As long as you read the chapter this class is easy. There is little communication with the prof but the syllabus outlines all expectations. Easy A if you are self-motivated and organized.

The material she posts every week is hard to understand and it is usually just a case study. It is hard to learn what she posts. There are four exams and MMES homework every week. There are a few discussions. I do not recommend taking her.

Tests and quizzes are what really matter and they can be hard if homework and textbook readings arent done. This professor doesnt always answer emails and sometimes makes quizzes and tests harder than they need to be.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Prof Kay is horrible for online classes. Finished the semester without her giving a single lecture; she ONLY instructed us to read the textbook. She doesn't respond to emails in a timely manner, and it somehow takes well over a week to grade a MULTIPLE CHOICE test given with lockdown on D2l. Not sure what she does, but it sure isn't teaching.
Save yourself the stress and choose someone else. Class isnt terribly difficult but she is not good to work with.

There is A LOT of homework and A LOT of reading. Quizzes and tests used webcam and lockdown browser, which I do not particularly do well with because of test anxiety. If I had read the textbook before the weekly quizzes from the beginning, I would have done better, but I didn't start that until the end. Read and do your homework and you're fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: My least favorite class and professor on campus so far. Not worth it.

I got an A but I had to really work for it. Test and quizzes all lockdown browser and a lot of them have short answer questions. She isn't very good at communicating to her students or really helping when she does. She'll ask really specific questions on the test deep in the chapters. She just makes the class harder then it should be.

Professor Abikoye is horrible. Makes everything way more difficult than it needs to be. I made good grades in her class but the workload was too much for this simple course. Others who have taken this same course with a different professor had a much better experience. Take someone else.

Im third year and this is the worst professor Ive had here. She takes forever to respond to emails, and when she does shes rude and not helpful. My entire groupme for the class complained about her daily and many even reported her to her supervisor. Seriously save yourself and take literally anyone else who teaches this class.

She makes things overly complicated for no reason like discussion posts. She takes a long time to grade things. Lockdown browser and webcam for all quizzes and tests. The tests are to only cover stuff from one unit but have random questions from all units. Study guides don't cover all info needed and include things, not from the textbook.

Professor is horrible. Responds slowly to emails and tests are hard. reading quizzes and labs would have thought to be straight forward but instead are not focused on the main topic. Lots of reading! grades take at least a month to be put in. Even when grades are in you have no idea what your final grade is because of how it is set up. DO NOT TAKE!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Abikoye was mediocre. She responded to many of my emails; some helpful and some not. I did not do as well as expected in the class. I felt as though some of the questions on tests were very specific where you would have to read the entire chapter word for word to know the answer. I studied well over a week for each test and did terrible.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Professor Abikoye makes this course harder than it needs to be. The labs are excessive and some of her test questions don't make sense. Choose another SCI1101 and SCI1102 professor. I took a different professor for SCI1102 and made an A and enjoyed the class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I'm sure professor Abikoye is a sweet lady but the class was nowhere near ideal. It is such an easy course however made very hard. The tests and quizzes are so specific you might as well read the textbook 14 times front to back. Seems to be a lot of busy work rather than teaching.
I am not even finished with this class yet and I already know I will not be receiving a good grade. She does not update her grades fast enough and makes it very difficult to know where you stand.

I'm an A student consistently, but this class ruined me. I studied more for this class than any other class I have ever taken. This professor has 4 exams that literally decide your fate. The exams are impossible to study for. I completely understood the material, but on exams, she asked the most specific questions imaginable. Oh lockdown + webcam

To be fair I missed a lot of assignments but there were a lot of problems. The class was decently organized online but the communication was substandard! The worst part of this class was how hard the tests were. I'm an A/B students and I still studied for 4 days, mastered the textbooks and only god a B on the last test. Would not suggest.

This class was okay, not the worst but definitely difficult. Lots of homework and if you miss questions, you can't retake the question to get higher credit. She uses lock down browser for tests so no open notes or book. She does not accept late work at all, or even for half credit. Only a few discussions but very big ones. Interesting class though!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Abikoye was a real disappointment. The content isn't bad, but she is extremely uncommunicative. In the online section I took, the labs asked you to do ridiculous things - it didn't really matter, because the quizzes didn't cover them. After each exam, check what got marked wrong - there were mistakes on every one that needed an email to fix.
Takes forever to upload grades. Assigns quite a bit of busy-work. Communication is very minimal. Material itself isnt super difficult. Many errors in test questions/grading
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This professor was very difficult. There is not much communication between the professor and the student and the tests are extremely hard. Do not expect an A in the class.

I'm a senior, and this is the worst professor I have ever taken. Zero personal communication with students, took weeks to enter grades, and made every assignment as difficult as she possibly could. Every test is lockdown and her "study guides" are useless. Tons of homework as well - most of it "busy work." Don't expect to get an A in this class.

To be blunt, class might as well have been taught by a robot. This class seemed to be the last thing on her priority list. Textbook reading, MES, quiz/exam every week. Not a huge workload, but she really didn't seem like she had any interest in this class. Little to nothing was actually written/said by her. Barely any supplemental materials.

Absolutely awful. She hardly communicated with us and rarely responded to emails. She posted most of our grades AFTER drop add so if people wanted to drop the class they no longer could. Her lecture notes do not help prepare you for the test, you can study like hell and still fail. Currently no one will make a A at this rate. It's ridiculous.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: DONT TAKE HER ONLINE. I took her in class for 1101 and she was amazing but nobody in my online 1102 class are going to be able to get over a C over all grade...

I took Professor Abikoye online, and she is terrible when it comes to communicating with her students. She'll post the syllabus at the start of the semester, and that is one of the only times you'll hear from her. She takes forever to put in grades and rarely responds to emails. Do not recommend for what should be an easy course.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Very nice person, but kinda stiff on the podium. A bit too politically correct. Test follow the materials. Lectures reinforce those. Grading is as lenient as a scantron can be. Extra credit for those environmentally minded students who can present in front of the class. Ask her about the roundabout with no exits.
very boring and very powerpoint so mnay lectures dont have to go to class recommend going to class though easy homework online no quizzes 4 tests no papers or projects extra credit offered
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She is not well-spoken, but she isn't tough on grading and the assignments are usually fair. Tests are alright.
great person and professor highly recommend

I can understand why there are some negative reviews on here. But its probably just a bunch of whiners. Professor Kay's class wasn't bad at all, while she can be quiet at times, for the most part, she is a good speaker. She gives outlines for each chapter if you do them getting an A on every test is a definite reality. Solid Choice and Underrated.

Even though attendance is not mandatory, you still need to attend because some of the things on the tests are specifically from the lectures and not in the textbook. There are several extra credit opportunities available.
she in nice, she let me redo an assignment, that would bump me up a letter grade, she understands what she is teaching. As long as you do the packets you should pass the class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: i personally liked her, but i can see why a lot of people wouldnt like her. class isnt mandatory and she offers extra credit. you do all the assignments and labs online. the only thing you do in class is lecture, exam preps,and the exams. she is nice and pretty easy to talk to if you have any questions. im going to be taking her for 1102.

Horrible public speaker. Couldnt stand to listen to her more than i had to. Tests are fairly easy if you read the text book before hand. I hardly ever came to class and i didnt miss much. Each test was roughly only 1 chapter of the text book. Online assignments were quick and easy but the labs were overkill
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I ended up not being able to attend class Right after the drop/add period ended and she was really understanding. Attendance not mandatory. I did all the work online easily enough and got A's on all the tests. Read the notes/chapter at least once and you'll be good for the test, lots of extra credit, interesting material, educated teacher but quiet
easy class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very sweet, uncomfortable speaking in front of class and not clear on material due to lack of clear communication

Mrs. Kay was not a bad teacher. She did not seem comfortable talking in front of crowds, but other than that she was great. She always had outlines for each chapter available online and the tests followed the outline well. She did say attendance was not mandatory, but she took attendance before tests and used that for extra credit.

This professor is a really sweet lady but she does not need to be teaching. She does not have the ability to speak in front of crowds. You can tell she really knows what she is talking about but she says just like almost every other word. Besides that she would be a great teacher. It was personally really distracting and i had a hard time following

I can't get over how may times this woman says "just like, " it's  literally after every word!  For such a lecture heavy class she isn't a good enough public speaker.  It's difficult to learn from someone who can't deliver a point in a confident manner.

She is super duper boring. I went to the first two classes, couldn't stay awake and never went back. (unless it was a test day) She says "um" and "like" in between every word and her class was in a lecture room but she speaks like she's talking to you from a foot away. way too quiet. puts powerpoints online and you can do the work yourself at home.

The class is very boring. The teacher talks very low and says like almost every other word. Even though you don't have to write all the notes because they are fill in, I feel like they aren't very helpful with the tests. None of the material lines up with each other. The homework doesn't align with the notes and the tests don't align with anything.

The class was very boring to sit through and it is a lecture heavy class. Teacher uses "um" or "like" every other word so it is hard to tell if she really knows what she is talking about. Also she makes her test way harder than they should be. Test were not like the info learned.
